Detailed Description

Copyright
2020 SICK AG. All rights reserved.

Calibration library containing functions to use for calibration and rectification of images captured with a SICK camera.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define CALIBRATION_API   __declspec(dllimport)

Typedef Documentation

typedef ResourceHandle CalibrationFilterHandle

The calibration filter handle is a reference to a combination of a model and descriptors of the expected input data.

The filter can be created with createCalibrationFilter().

typedef void* ImageBuffer

Pointer to an image buffer of some data type.

typedef ImageBuffer Images2D[]

Array of ImageBuffers.

typedef void(* LogMessageHandler)(const char *logMessage)

Log handler signature for replacing the default standard out handler.

typedef ResourceHandle ModelHandle

The model handle is a reference to a model created using createModelFromJson() or createModelFromFilePath().

The model contains information on how to transform raw data from the camera into world coordinates.

typedef ResourceHandle RectificationFilterHandle

The rectification filter handle is a reference to a combination of rectification setting and buffer descriptors.

The filter can be created with createRectificationFilter().

typedef uint32_t ResourceHandle

A handle to a resource allocated withing the dll.

Could be an ModelHandle, CalibrationFilterHandle or RectificationFilterHandle.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum CoordinateSystem

Describes the available coordinates systems.

Enumerator
UNCALIBRATED 
CALIBRATED 
enum PixelFormat

Certain cameras can transfer their data with different pixel format.

These are the pixel formats currently supported by the calibration library.

Enumerator
MONO_8 

Used for 8-bit 2D images.

MONO_16 

Used for 16-bit 2D images.

PFNC_COORD_3D_C16 

Used for 16-bit 3D images.

enum RectificationMode

Controls how the rectification handles attempts to write the same pixel.

Enumerator
MEAN 

Takes the average of the height values during rectification.

TOP 

Takes the highest height value encountered.

BOTTOM 

Takes the lowest height value encountered.

DARKEST 

Takes the height value with the lowest reflectance value.

BRIGHTEST 

Takes the height value with the highest reflectance value.

enum RunMode

Controls which calibration implementation to used.

Enumerator
FLOAT32 

Single precision, no SIMD optimization.

FLOAT64 

Double precision, no SIMD optimization.

VECTOR32 

Single precision, with SIMD optimization.

VECTOR64 

Double precision, with SIMD optimization.

Function Documentation

CALIBRATION_API bool applyCalibration ( CalibrationFilterHandle  calibrationFilterHandle,
uint8_t  inputBufferRange[],
float  outputBufferX[],
float  outputBufferZ[] 
)

Calibrates a range buffer by converting it to a point cloud in X and Z.

The output consists of two buffers each containing one of the X/Z point pair.

Parameters
calibrationFilterHandlehandle to a calibration filter
inputBufferRangePointer to a buffer containing range data according to sensorTraits. Should contain imageSize.height * imageSize.width elements of type pixelFormat.
outputBufferXPointer to a pre-allocated buffer of size width * height * sizeof(float) where the X outputs shall be written.
outputBufferZPointer to a pre-allocated buffer of size width * height * sizeof(float) where the Z outputs shall be written.
Returns
true when successful
CALIBRATION_API bool calculateCalibrationBounds ( ModelHandle  modelHandle,
SensorTraits  sensorTraits,
ImageSize  imageSize,
WorldRangeTraits *  outputWorldRangeTraits,
SplatSettings *  outputSplatSettings,
const uint16_t  rectificationWidth 
)

Given a calibration model and sensor traits calculates a bounding box of were the data will end up in the world coordinates.

Parameters
modelHandlemodel describing how to transform into world coordinates
sensorTraitsdescription of the data format from the sensor
imageSizedescription of the width and height of the inputBuffer
outputWorldRangeTraitsrecommended bounding box for the maximum/minimum world values
outputSplatSettingsdefault splat setting according to the model/FOV
rectificationWidthdesired rectification width, xSteps be modified accordingly, if 0, imageWidth will be used
Returns
true when successful
CALIBRATION_API bool createCalibrationFilter ( ModelHandle  modelHandle,
SensorTraits  sensorTraits,
ImageSize  imageSize,
PixelFormat  pixelFormat,
CalibrationFilterHandle *  calibrationFilterHandle 
)

Creates a calibration filter to be used with applyCalibration().

Parameters
modelHandlemodel describing how to transform into world coordinates
sensorTraitsdescription of the data format from the sensor
imageSizedescription of the width and height of the inputBufferRange
pixelFormatthe data type of the inputBufferRange
calibrationFilterHandlea handle to the created filter
Returns
true if the filter is created successfully

CALIBRATION_API bool createModelFromFilePath ( const char *  filePath,
ModelHandle *  modelHandle 
)

Allocate and create a calibration model from a Json file and return a reference to it.

Parameters
filePatha file path to a Json file containing the calibration model
modelHandlepointer to where the output model handle is written. Set to INVALID_RESOURCE_HANDLE on failure.
Returns
true on success

ModelHandle *  modelHandle 
)

Parameters

modelHandlepointer to where the output model handle is written. Set to INVALID_RESOURCE_HANDLE on failure.
Returns

CALIBRATION_API bool createRectificationFilter ( SplatSettings  splatSettings,
RectificationMode  rectificationMode,
WorldRangeTraits  worldRangeTraits,
ImageSize  imageSize,
CoRectifiedDescription  coRectifiedDescription,
float  missingDataValue,
RectificationFilterHandle *  rectificationFilterHandle 
)

Creates a filter for point cloud rectification.

The filter can be used from rectify():

Parameters
splatSettingssplat settings for the rectification
rectificationModetreatment when multiple Z/co-rectified points end up on the same pixel in the rectified buffer
worldRangeTraitswhere in in the world rectified buffer is located
imageSizethe size of inputBufferX, inputBufferZ and inputCoRectified
coRectifiedDescriptiona description of the coRectified data
missingDataValuevalue that will be used for missing data, e.g., 0
rectificationFilterHandlehandle to the created rectification filter.
Returns
true when successful

Destroy the calibration filter that the handle refers to and release its memory.

Parameters
handlereference to the filter to destroy. Set to INVALID_RESOURCE_HANDLE on a successful release.
Returns
true when the handle is successfully released

CALIBRATION_API bool mapPoints ( Point2D *  input,
Point2D *  output,
size_t  numberOfPoints,
ModelHandle  modelHandle,
CoordinateSystem  from,
CoordinateSystem  to 
)

Transforms points from one coordinate system to another.

Parameters
inputarray of point to be transformed
outputwhere to write the tranformed points. To be allocated by the user.
numberOfPointsthe number of points to transform
modelHandlehandle to the calibration model describing the transform.
fromthe coordinate system of the input points
tothe coordinate system of the output points
Returns
true on success
CALIBRATION_API WorldTransformTraits rangeTraitsToTransform ( WorldRangeTraits  traits)

Calculates WorldTransformTraits based on WorldRangeTraits.

Convenience function to get xRange and yRange transformations, which are needed during calibration.

Parameters
traitswhere in the world the rectified buffer is
Returns
transform How to transform pixel index to world position. Currently only float values are supported for zRange Hence zRange does not need to be transformed.
CALIBRATION_API bool rectify ( RectificationFilterHandle  rectificationFilterHandle,
float  inputBufferX[],
float  inputBufferZ[],
Images2D  inputCoRectified,
float  outputRange[],
Images2D  outputCoRectified 
)

Rectifies a point cloud given by x,y into a heightmap.

Parameters
rectificationFilterHandleHandle to the rectification filter. Can be created with createRectificationFilter().
inputBufferXa buffer containing the X positions of the calibrated data
inputBufferZa buffer containing the Z positions of the calibrated data
inputCoRectifiedAn array of pointers each pointing to the start of a buffer to be co-rectified. This might, e.g., be an reflectance or scatter buffer. All buffers should have the same size as the size of the calibrated data. The size of the array and the data-types of the buffers are set in the coRectifiedDescription.
outputRangePointer to a pre-allocated buffer where to put the rectified range data. The data type is float and the buffer should have the size worldRangeTraits.xRange.steps * worldRangeTraits.yRange.steps.
outputCoRectifiedAn array of pointers each pointing to a pre-allocated buffer where the co-rectified data should be put. All buffers are uint8_t and should have the same size as the size of the rectified data.
Returns
true when successful
CALIBRATION_API void registerLogHandler ( LogMessageHandler  handler)

Warnings and errors are forwarded to standard out by a default log handler.

By registering a new log handler callback it is possible to redirect log messages such as error information and warnings.

Parameters
handlerfunction called on each generated log message
CALIBRATION_API void setNumberOfThreads ( int  threads)

Tries to set the number of threads used.

Can fail. Query with getNumberOfThreads() afterwards.

Parameters
threadsprefered number of theards to use
CALIBRATION_API bool setRunMode ( CalibrationFilterHandle  calibrationFilterHandle,
RunMode  runMode 
)

Sets the runMode of a calibrationFilter.

Parameters
calibrationFilterHandlehandle to a calibration filter
runModethe calibration implementation to used
Returns
true on success

Variable Documentation

const ResourceHandle INVALID_RESOURCE_HANDLE = 0
const size_t MAX_NUM_RESOURCE_HANDLES = 256
static

Maximum amount of models, calibration filters or rectification filters that can be allocated in the library.

If more models than this is attempted to be allocated a return indicating error will be returned instead, when a new resource is attempted to be allocated.

const LogMessageHandler STDOUT_MESSAGE_REDIRECT = NULL
